definition: to be contaminated/to be gradually influenced
to dye/to catch (a disease)/to acquire (bad habits etc)/to contaminate/to add color washes to a painting

sentences.english: The enemy was advancing. The snow was stained with blood.
sentences.chinese: 首都被迫弃守，敌人步步进逼，鲜血将白雪浸染。

sentences.english: The Dexing copper mine in Jiangxi Province is a porphyry copper ore field of veinlet-disseminated type.
sentences.chinese: 江西德兴铜矿是一个细脉浸染型斑岩铜矿田。

sentences.english: Alteration of similar nature is also reported in connection with the disseminations in layers and the massive nests .
sentences.chinese: 同样的馈变在浸染状矿层及块状矿巢中也都存在。

sentences.english: Fresh-cut fruits and vegetables are extremely apt to rot, because of the fact of the microorganism infects.
sentences.chinese: 鲜切果蔬极易腐烂变质，主要是由于微生物浸染所致。

sentences.english: Gaolong microdisseminated gold deposit is located in Tianlin County in northwestern Guangxi Province.
sentences.chinese: 桂西北高龙微细浸染型金矿床位于广西田林县高龙乡。

sentences.english: Two micro-disseminated gold metallogenic belts are discovered and affirmed.
sentences.chinese: 发现并肯定两条微细浸染型金矿化带。

sentences.english: Calcareous siltstone is the main host rock of micro fine disseminated gold deposit(MDGD).
sentences.chinese: 微细浸染型金矿赋矿岩石以钙质粉砂岩为主。

sentences.english: Dye eggs desired colors and let dry completely.
sentences.chinese: 把鸡蛋浸染在喜欢的颜色里，然后等其完全干透。

sentences.english: People can get sick if they eat food touched by floodwaters.
sentences.chinese: 人们如果食用了被洪水浸染过的食物就会得病。

sentences.english: A thermoplastic material impregnated with lampblack .
sentences.chinese: 一种用灯黑浸染的塑性材料。

sentences.english: Spring is definitely a life-ching disseminated the canvas color.
sentences.chinese: 春，绝对是一桢浸染着生命之色的画布。

sentences.english: Lastly, it is prognosticated that there may be medium-deep seated lead-zine deposit and porphyry copper deposit occurenced in Wubohao area.
sentences.chinese: 中深部可能赋存有铅锌矿床和浸染状斑岩型铜矿床。

sentences.english: They dipped the fabric in a vat of dye.
sentences.chinese: 他们在染缸中浸染织品。

sentences.english: Surface pretended not to know, secretly but wine disseminated in a shaw in.
sentences.chinese: 表面装着不知道，暗地里却将毒酒浸染在一只萧上在。

sentences.english: The copper is disseminated in small joint surfaces and cracks in the porphyries .
sentences.chinese: 铜浸染在斑岩的细小节理面和裂隙中。

definition: to permeate/to percolate/fig. to saturate (with emotion)
to exert a gradual influence/to nurture/a corrupting influence
(usually of sth intangible) to seep into/to permeate
deposits accumulated over long periods/fig. valuable experience, accumulated wisdom
to pollute (often fig.)/to be infected by/to gain a small advantage
to cleanse/to scrub/to scour/to wash down/to erode/to wash away
